Personally, I don't think supporting Kalista's "solo-carry" style at the expense of her "duo-carry" style is the right direction to take.  The point of her Oathsworn, Sentinel passive and Fate's Call is so that she will be more reliant on her support than other ADC's.  Kalista was designed to be weaker than other ADC's without her Oathsworn, but very strong with her Oathsworn.  By emphasizing her solo capabilities and downplaying her interactions with her Oathsworn, Riot is undermining the most unique parts of her, as well as undermining her thematically.

I already wrote my own comment on this, but I agree. It's strange and short-sighted and doesn't even really accomplish the stated goals that well. All it does is nerf her laning power and put her ult on a longer cooldown than it should be. I have no idea what would prompt it either; she already does worse than average against Mordekaiser, Now and Forever King of Bot Lane (who, as others have noted, has not been touched this patch despite ruthlessly crushing the lane and having a positive win rate in every single matchup down there as well as the highest bot lane win rate overall) and has already been chipped away at constantly with nerfs since her release. Making her worse at the cool, unique thing she has is unnecessary and depressing.
